item.title: Fortnite Chapter 7 Leaks Reveal Driveable Reboot Vans & Bots Mode
item.content:encoded:
Major Fortnite leaks for Chapter 7 content have begun to flood social media following a creator preview event in Los Angeles, with standout details including driveable reboot vans and a dedicated bots mode.

Epic Games is gearing up for the major Zero Hour end-of-chapter event next week, which will be followed by the start of Chapter 7, Season 1, and big changes are on the cards that will impact various core mechanics of the game.

Driveable Reboot Vans, Bots Mode & Storm Size Changes Coming

According to reliable leakers, including ShiinaBR, some of the biggest gameplay changes coming to Fortnite in Chapter 7 include reboot vans being driveable, an overhaul to the gameplay UI, and a dedicated Solo vs Bots mode.

Bots are nothing new in Fortnite and are widely used to populate Battle Royale lobbies to reduce wait time, but introducing a dedicated mode where solo players go head-to-head with them is a big change. However, there is still plenty to be detailed about the game mode.

Driveable reboot vans align with previous hints towards a revamp of the reboot system in Fortnite, which will result in changes to gameplay tactically as reboot vans will be moveable, thus becoming a core resource later in games to revive fallen teammates, or prevent opponents from bringing back their squad.

Another big change, again leaked by ShiinaBR, shows that storm sizes are being adjusted in Chapter 7 away from the standard circle closing in, instead having a ‘seven’ shape. However, it’s mentioned that the sizes and timings are not final.

Epic Games will reveal all the major changes to Fortnite in Chapter 7 closer to the release date, likely sharing the full details in a pre-launch blog ahead of the start of the new chapter on December 30.

What feature should Fortnite look to change in Chapter 7? Share your thoughts in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Fortnite, check out all the quests and rewards in the Party Up – Winter Rush event, and read about the addition of Unity games in 2026.

item.title: When is Fortnite Chapter 7, Season 1? Release Date & Expected Start Time
item.content:encoded:
Another year in Fortnite is drawing to a close, and a new chapter is on the horizon. Insider Gaming has all the details about when Chapter 7, Season 1 kicks off in the game.

The past year in Fortnite has been full of huge collabs, including the likes of The Simpsons, Star Wars, Godzilla, and Power Rangers, and Chapter 7 is likely to follow in a similar trend with other huge crossovers.

For all the details about the launch of Fortnite Chapter 7, Season 1, take a look at the guide below.

What is The Fortnite Chapter 7, Season 1 Release Date?

Chapter 7, Season 1 in Fortnite is due to kick off on Sunday, November 30, as confirmed by Epic Games themselves.

Epic Games has begun to tease the new chapter, including a big collab with Quentin Tarantino’s Kill Bill, which is set to be one of the first major collabs of Chapter 7 in Fortnite.

The tease confirmed the release date for Fortnite Chapter 7, which comes the day after the big Zero Hour live event, bringing an end to Chapter 6, which is expected to be followed by downtime soon in the early hours of the morning on November 30 ahead of the season launch.

Do We Know The Fortnite Chapter 7, Season 1 Start Time?

No official start time for Fortnite Chapter 7, Season 1 has been announced by Epic Games, nor is it expected that a precise time will be shared due to the maintenance length, but history provides an idea of how long downtime will be.

Fortnite’s Zero Hour live event takes place at 2 PM ET on November 29, and server downtime is expected to follow soon after. While it’s unlikely to be immediate, downtime should take place at the usual start time of around 2 AM ET on November 30, and they will be out of action for a while.

In 2024, downtime before the launch of Chapter 6 was seven hours, but a year earlier, the Big Bang event was followed by 11 hours of downtime—with the longer spell likely due to the variety of new modes that were launched, including LEGO Fortnite and Fortnite Festival.

In 2022, end-of-chapter downtime was 9 hours, while 2021 downtime was a staggering 18 hours. However, nothing compares to The End event in October 2019, which was followed by 36 hours of downtime.

Based on this, don’t expect Fortnite Chapter 7, Season 1 to be live until 9 AM ET at the very earliest, and the wait could be many hours longer. As usual, social media is the best place to keep track.

What are your expectations for Fortnite during Chapter 7? Share your thoughts in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Fortnite, check out all the quests and rewards during the Party Up – Winter Rush event, and take a look at the news that Unity games will be available in Fortnite in 2026.

item.title: All Fortnite Party Up – Winter Rush Quests & Rewards, Listed
item.content:encoded:
Fortnite is heading for a thrilling end to Chapter 6 with a huge live event on the horizon, but before the start of a new chapter with new collabs and a new map, there are exclusive rewards to earn in the Party Up – Winter Rush event.

The annual season of giving is upon players in Fortnite, with plenty more expected during Chapter 7, Season 1 next month, and it all begins with the Party Up – Winter Rush event that offers a bunch of rewards simply for playing the game.

There’s only a limited amount of time to claim the rewards before they disappear, but this guide has you covered with all the crucial information you need.

All Fortnite Party Up – Winter Rush Quests

Quests in the Party Up – Winter Rush event are released daily, with one per day for creator-made experiences and another for Epic experiences.

The quests will have you and your friends venturing across everything Fortnite has to offer, with requirements sending you into different game modes and styles.

While not all of the quests are available right now, they have been datamined and revealed. Additionally, you can hold off until the final days of the event to complete them all, as they are not removed, which may make it easier to complete.

Party Up – Winter Rush quests are available until November 29 at 2 PM ET.

Epic Made Experience Quests

  • Earn 80,000 XP in Festival or Rocket Racing in a party with friends.
  • Earn 80,000 XP in LEGO Fortnite in a party with friends.
  • Earn 80,000 XP in Blitz Royale or Save The World in a party with friends.
  • Earn 80,000 XP in Reload or Delulu in a party with friends.
  • Earn 80,000 XP in Battle Royale or Fortnite OG in a party with friends.

Creator-Made Experience Quests

  • Earn 80,000 XP in Tycoon Creator-made Islands in a party with friends.
  • Earn 80,000 XP in Survival Creator-made Islands in a party with friends.
  • Earn 80,000 XP in Role Playing Creator-made Islands in a party with friends.
  • Earn 80,000 XP in Combat Creator-made Islands in a party with friends.
  • Earn 80,000 XP in Battle Royale Creator-made Islands in a party with friends.

Mobile

  • Invite a friend using your mobile sidebar.
  • Earn 80,000 XP in a party with friends while on Fortnite Mobile.

All Fortnite Party Up – Winter Rush Rewards

The main reward from the Party Up – Winter Rush event in Fortnite is the Cuddle Team Rider Outfit, so there are plenty of other rewards to claim, too.

A matching Pickaxe, Back Bling, Spray, and Plushie are also available, along with Jam Tracks and more content. A comprehensive list of all rewards is presented in the table below.

What do you want to see Fortnite introduce in Chapter 7? Share your wishlist with other players in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Fortnite, read about the addition of Unity Games in 2026, and check out how to claim Fortnite Crew with an Xbox Game Pass Subscription.
